title: User Calculator Navigation and Usage
description: Verify that the user can successfully navigate to the home page, use the dynamic dropdown to select a service module (Civil, Electrical, HVAC), open the relevant calculator, and perform calculations without errors.

steps.description: Navigate to the home page of the Bishwo Calculator web application.
Verify that the dynamic dropdown menu for service modules (Civil, Electrical, HVAC) is visible and populated.
Select each service module from the dropdown one by one.
Confirm that the relevant calculators for the selected module are displayed.
Open a calculator from the displayed list for the selected module.
Confirm that the calculator page loads without errors.
Perform sample calculations with valid inputs.
Verify that calculation results are displayed correctly and promptly.
Attempt calculations with invalid inputs including extreme values and boundary cases.
Verify appropriate error messages or validations handle invalid inputs gracefully.

title: Theme Upload Validation and Activation
description: Ensure administrators can upload new themes via /admin/themes, that uploads are validated for compliance with rules, and that themes can be activated successfully, triggering dynamic CSS application on the front end.

steps.description: Log in as an administrator.
Navigate to /admin/themes.
Attempt to upload a valid theme package that meets validation criteria.
Verify that the theme upload completes successfully without errors.
Confirm that the theme passes all validation checks (file integrity, manifest correctness, compatibility).
Preview the newly uploaded theme.
Check that the preview accurately reflects the theme's design without layout or rendering issues.
Activate the newly uploaded theme.
Verify that the activation succeeds and the dynamic CSS is applied on the front end.
Attempt to upload an invalid or corrupted theme package.
Confirm that the system rejects the upload with appropriate validation error messages.

title: Theme Customization and Dynamic CSS Application
description: Verify that administrators can customize theme settings and that changes are immediately reflected in the UI with proper dynamic CSS application.

steps.description: Log in as administrator and navigate to active theme customization settings under /admin/themes.
Modify multiple theme settings such as colors, fonts, and layout options.
Confirm that the system saves customization changes without errors.
Verify that the front end UI reflects the customizations immediately with correct dynamic CSS applied.
Reset customization settings to defaults.
Verify that the theme reverts to default appearance and CSS correctly.

title: Plugin Upload, Validation, Activation, Deactivation and Deletion
description: Test the complete plugin lifecycle including uploading valid and invalid plugins, validating plugin manifests, toggling activation status, and deleting plugins without system errors.

steps.description: Log in as administrator and navigate to plugin management interface.
Upload a valid plugin with a correct manifest file.
Verify successful plugin upload and that manifest validation passes.
Try activating the newly uploaded plugin.
Confirm plugin activates without errors and functionalities are available.
Deactivate the plugin.
Verify plugin deactivation is successful and its features are disabled.
Delete the plugin.
Verify the plugin is completely removed from the system without residual data.
Attempt to upload a plugin with an invalid manifest or missing required fields.
Confirm that upload is rejected with detailed validation error messages.

title: Backup Creation, Export, Restore, and Download
description: Ensure administrators can create full system backups including database and themes/plugins, export them correctly, restore system state from backups, and download backup files without corruption.

steps.description: Log in as administrator and navigate to /admin/help for backup management.
Initiate creation of a full system backup.
Verify backup completes successfully including database dump and theme/plugin files.
Export the created backup package.
Confirm the exported backup file downloads properly and is not corrupted.
Make system changes after backup, then initiate restore from backup file.
Verify system restores completely to the backed-up state without errors.
Attempt backup creation with insufficient storage space or invalid permissions.
Confirm proper error handling and informative error messages.

title: Audit Log Filtering, Viewing, and Download
description: Validate that the audit log viewer displays correct logs with various filters, supports downloading of selected log files, and handles edge cases such as empty filters or large log sets.

steps.description: Log in as administrator and navigate to /admin/audit-logs.
Apply filters on audit logs by date range, user, event type, and severity.
Verify that filtered results match the selected criteria accurately.
Attempt filtering with criteria that returns no logs.
Confirm that the viewer properly indicates no results without errors or crashes.
Select filtered log entries and download the log file.
Verify downloaded logs are complete, uncorrupted, and conform to expected format.

title: Admin POST Route Security: Rate Limiting and CSRF Protection
description: Test that administrative POST routes enforce rate limiting to prevent abuse and require valid CSRF tokens to protect against cross-site request forgery attacks.

steps.description: Log in as administrator.
Perform repeated POST requests on admin routes (e.g., theme upload, plugin toggle) rapidly to trigger rate limiting.
Verify that requests beyond the threshold are blocked with rate limiting response codes/messages.
Attempt a POST request to an admin endpoint without including a CSRF token.
Confirm that the request is rejected with an appropriate CSRF protection error.
Submit POST requests with expired or invalid CSRF tokens.
Verify rejection of these requests to confirm CSRF protection is enforced.

title: Structured Logging and Audit Logger Integrity
description: Verify that system logs and audit logs are structured correctly, contain required fields, and capture relevant events for auditing purposes.

steps.description: Perform various system actions including user logins, theme activation, plugin toggling, backup creation, and API calls.
Access the structured logs and audit logs files or interface.
Verify each log entry contains timestamp, event type, user info (when applicable), and detailed message.
Confirm that audit logs specifically capture sensitive changes like theme activations, backups, and plugin management.
Verify logs are formatted in a consistent, machine-parseable structure (e.g., JSON or defined schema).

title: API v1 Health Endpoint Response Validation
description: Ensure that the /api/v1/health endpoint reliably returns a 200 OK HTTP status with a well-formed JSON response indicating system availability.

steps.description: Send GET requests to /api/v1/health endpoint at various times and under different system loads.
Confirm the response HTTP status is always 200 OK.
Verify the response body contains expected JSON properties indicating system health status.
Simulate partial system failures or maintenance mode, then request the /api/v1/health endpoint.
Verify the endpoint response indicates degraded system health or appropriate error information while maintaining valid JSON.
